It was a cold night.

Thanksgiving was usually full of joy and happiness with the bright moonlight shining upon us. But that day was different.

The thought of something could go wrong wouldn't get out of my head. Something went wrong. Really wrong.

Mutated Poporis suddenly swarmed our farm. The grownups went out and fought. My sister and I were too little, so we stayed inside.
The villagers didn't stand a chance. There were too muny of them. Soon, the mutants came inside the farm.Read the next page.

I couldn't move. My sister had to grab my hand, drag me to the back door.
My sister threw me out the door and cried out

"Run! Don't look back!"

I did what she said. I didn't look back. I just ran.
But the mutants kept chasing me. I don't remember how long I kept running. I got tired and the mutants were getting closer.Read the next page.

When I fell down, it seemed as if the moonlight shimmered. It was almost as if the moon shattered into pieces.
But it wasn't the moon. A mutant fell down and before I could notice it, they were all gone.
When I woke up, a runeglaive and a letter were lying on the ground.

"Just as the moonlight guided my path to you, I hope this runeglaive will help you."

After I read the letter, I knew what to do. I grabbed the runeglaive and headed back. Back to Popolion.
